result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:13 AM Defendant Joseph A Weiss in court.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Joseph A Weiss.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests to change their plea to not quilty by reason of mental disease or defect.
Court accepts the special plea and orders an examination be completed under Wis. Stats. 971.16.
Defense requests Dr. Westendorf be appointed.
Court will appoint Dr. Westendorf to complete the examination and file a report by 11/7/22.
Review hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:43 AM Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph A Weiss in court.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Joseph A Weiss. 
Case called for jury status hearing.
Parties have reached an agreement.
Court notes a discrepancy with the incident date in the information.
State agrees and corrects the information on the record.
Court orders the State to file an amended information by 8/22/22.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  
Court will not accept the plea and orders the hearing vacated up to this point.
Jury trial canceled.
Court will set for further proceedings.
State notes the amended information has been filed.
Court orders the State to review the day of the week in the amended information and file a second amended information by 8/24/22 if necessary.
